1890819848|Data Scientist|Ho Chi Minh City
Role Description
The Forward Deployed Engineer is involved in the end-to-end life-cycle of a DX customer engagement. They are responsbile for capturing user needs
column2: implementing solutions and rolling out to users. While no 2 days are the same in this role the expected activities at the different stages of a customer engagement would be:

column1: Problem discovery phase: Go onsite and meet with customer analysts to understand the critical questions they need to answer and locate their biggest pain points. Perform problem exploration through user interviews

Solution exploration phase: strategise and iterate through different ways in which the presented problem could be solved. Support deployment strategist in building finalised solution vision and realistic MVP design. Evaluate and select best solution(s) based on risk and reward.

MVP Development Phase: Breakdown solution design and user-stories into actionable and understandable development tasks within an agile software development framework. Implement dev tasks assigned to you. Support the allocation of tasks to supporting teams. Perform regular feedback and iterations with customer on progress
column2: demoing what has been done where possible. Ensure during development that the targeted value is always front and centre.

column1: MVP Roll-out phase: Perform user-onboarding sessions
column2: collect and capture feedback. Collect and prioritise feature requests based on the value they bring and the cost to implement. Manage bug reports and quickly make fixes where possible. Make value assessment on how the MVP is quantitively and qualitatively solving the targeted problem.

column1: Scale and run phase: Breakdown solution design and user-stories into actionable and understandable development tasks within an agile software development framework. Implement dev tasks assigned to you. Support and lead handover with other FPT teams.
Skills and Competencies

We will be evaluating this position across 2 axes: the technical axis (experience in implementing technical solutions) and value axis (problem solving and business acumen). The position is more weighted towards the technical side but requires a minimum competence level in both. However
column2: if you feel that you don’t completely meet all the requirements but could grow into the role
column3: we will also assess your potential along the different axes.
